source_sentence: 此律儀總於一切生草等上。
translation: This restraint is generalized to all living things like grasses and other things.
It attains uniformity without expression.

source_sentence: 而世間無有無生草等時。
translation: When there's nothing in the world that doesn't have growing weeds and so forth, that's it.
It's general in regard to all the wine made from pandanus and so forth.
When it doesn't break down, then it attains one absence of expression.
They attain one manifestation of nothingness.
When there's nothing in the world that lacks wine, then the rest of the world doesn't perish.

source_sentence: 是故律儀無於一有增減。
translation: Therefore, there's no single instance in which the rest of the precepts increase or decrease.
The rest is likewise.
(Commentator:) The rest are thus.
All kinds of unlawful clothing and food are of the same type.
Each one of them has no expression above the other.
It's not discriminated according to a particle of dust or so forth.

source_sentence: 念我唯於其類有情當離煞等。
translation: He's mindful that I'm the only one of these sentient beings who will be free of killing and so forth.
Second, he's concentrated in a branch.

source_sentence: 念我唯於某律儀支當持不犯。
translation: He's mindful that I'm the only one who will maintain and not transgress a certain branch of the precepts.
The third concentration is in a certain place.

source_sentence: 念我唯住某處方域當離煞等。
translation: He's mindful that I only live in a certain place or region and will become free of killing and so forth.
The fourth concentration is at the right time.

source_sentence: 念我唯於一月等時能離煞等。
translation: He's mindful that I'll be able to avoid killing and so forth only during the month of January and so forth.
The fifth condition is concentration.

source_sentence: 念我唯除鬪戰等緣能離煞等。
translation: He's mindful that I can become free of killing and so forth only by removing such conditions as fighting.
Someone who thus experiences this will not be disciplined.
He doesn't attain restraint.
